# Practice Problems

## 3.145
$m(t) = E(e^{ty}) = \sum_{y=0}^{n} \binom{n}{y} (pe^t)^y (1-p)^{n - y} = (pe^t + 1 - p)^n$


## 3.147

$m(t) = E(e^{ty}) = \sum_{y=1}^{\infty}pe^{ty}q^{y - 1} = pe^t\sum_{(y-1)=0}^{\infty}(qe^t)^{y - 1} = \frac{pe^t}{1 - qe^t}$

Note the second-to-last step is because $e^{ty} = (e^t)^{y - 1}e^t$ and the final step is recognizing the geometric series $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty}a^n = \frac{1}{1 - a}$.
